newsitem.title: UK: British Gas undecided on Morecambe Bay field.
newsitem.headline: British Gas undecided on Morecambe Bay field.

text.p: British Gas said on Monday said it was still undecided on any possible sell-off of Morecambe Bay, Britain's biggest gas field, saying it was too early for details to be finalised.
"It has been going on for a few months. It is not an option that is ruled out," a British Gas spokesman told Reuters.
The Sunday Times newspaper had reported on Sunday that the field, which supplies about a fifth of U.K.'s gas, would be sold either to a single purchaser or broken up into smaller parcels.
The British Gas official said the company had not decided on the mode of sale.
He said the company did not have an accurate valuation of the field either.
Last week British Gas reached a deal with British Petroleum over take-or-pay contracts which oblige the company to buy more gas than it can sell.

British Gas also struck a similar deal with its own production unit. BP and the production unit would be paid compensation totalling 293 million stg for giving British Gas relief in volumes and prices.
The utility is still busy renegotiating contracts with other North Sea gas producers.
"Morecambe Bay is linked to the complications of the take-or pay negotiations," the official said.
